meanings.definition: To declare someone free from guilt or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The judge decided to absolve the defendant of all charges.
meanings.sent2: The priest absolved the sinner of their sins during confession.
meanings.sent3: The magic fairy absolved the naughty child of any wrongdoing with a wave of her wand.
meanings.sent4: The rain seemed to absolve the city of its grime, leaving everything fresh and clean.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt apology was enough to absolve any lingering doubts about his innocence.

meanings.definition: To forgive or pardon someone for their sins or wrongdoings.
meanings.sent1: She was willing to absolve her friend for the mistake they made.
meanings.sent2: The king decided to absolve the prisoner and grant him a full pardon.
meanings.sent3: The teacher absolved the student's late homework because of the unexpected snow day.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to absolve the ocean of its worries, painting the sky in hues of pink and gold.
meanings.sent5: The kind words spoken by the elder were enough to absolve any lingering resentment in the room.
